to examine/to inquire/to observe/to inspect/to look into/obvious/clearly evident

to offer a sacrifice to (gods or ancestors)/memorial ceremony/(in classical novels) to recite an incantation to activate a magic weapon/(lit. and fig.) to wield
to inspect/to observe and study/on-the-spot investigation
public prosecutor/public procurator (judicial officer whose job may involve both criminal investigation and public prosecution)

to sense/to perceive/to become aware of/to detect

sentences.english: Dayu flood control have to review the Western Regions Mountain View Distinguish the flow of water.
sentences.chinese: 大禹治水也曾到西域察山观水明辨流向。

sentences.english: The police found a letter which implicated him in the robbery.
sentences.chinese: 察发现了一封信，这封信把他牵连到抢劫案中。

sentences.english: "Do you know this fellow's name? " asked the cop.
sentences.chinese: “你知道这个家伙的名字吗”察问道。

sentences.english: What probably happened is that the writer lapsed into colloquial language, writing in a conversational style.
sentences.chinese: 作者可能一时不察，让写作风格受到口语对话的影响。

sentences.english: Hong Kong is now at the watershed between stability and unrest. The central government cannot be too wary of that.
sentences.chinese: 香港现正处于安危治乱的转捩点，中央对此不能不察。

sentences.english: Love is not a trace of police, will bring the disgraceful life darkness.
sentences.chinese: 明心一丝不察，将带来蒙尘一世的黑暗。

sentences.english: This is a deep-seated problems, must be aware of this.
sentences.chinese: 这是深层次是问题，不可不察。

definition: outstanding/particularly, especially/a fault/to express discontentment against
